messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Sesame street (school busses)
messages.msgSnippet: My 5dd had absolutely no interest in going to school until she saw the big yellow school busses on the PBS cartoons (I think it was actually Arthur). She
messages.messageBody:
My 5dd had absolutely no interest in going to school until she saw the
big yellow school busses on the PBS cartoons (I think it was actually
Arthur). She wanted desperately to ride on one. We kind of let it go,
figuring she would get past this, but she didn't. They made it look like
so much fun. One day my husband comes up the driveway with a yellow
school bus. A local school district was selling their perfectly good band
bus, and he was at the right place at the right time, and it was really
cheap. So now my DD's have a bus of their very own, and they play in it
and go for occasional rides. I realize that this is not practical for
everyone, but I thought it was a super sweet thing to do on my hubby's
part, and the desire to go to school for the sake of the bus ride is in
the past.
Wende
On Sat, 11 Jan 2003 23:23:25 -0000 "kayb85 <sheran@...>"
<sheran@...> writes:
>
> > There are complaints I could make about Sesame Street, about
> specific moments
> > or little videos which are really outdated and I wish they hadn't
>
> shown. I
> > wish they had promoted breastfeeding instead of showing bottlefed
>
> babies.
> > But musically it's wonderful. Every musical style ever was
> represented.
> >
>
> I saw a video on Sesame Street that showed kids getting ready for
> preschool, and showed kids what a fun thing preschool was. I wish,
>
> when they do things to get kids excited about school and show them
> getting on these cool yellow school buses, that they would also show
>
> the kids at home who don't go to school, and how much fun they're
> having too.
>
> Of course that's not true of only Sesame Street, but of most tv
> shows
> in general.
>
> Sheila
>
